item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 9, 2025 at 6:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Evolving Agents Framework (23 points | 1 comment)
2. It is as if you were on your phone (219 points | 33 comments)
3. Mako: An extremely fast, production-grade web bundler based on Rust by Ant Group (42 points | 13 comments)
4. Improving on std:count_if()'s auto-vectorization (69 points | 17 comments)
5. TeX Live 2025 Released (24 points | 21 comments)
6. Do you DARE? Europe bets once again on RISC-V for supercomputing sovereignty (29 points | 14 comments)
7. PurrCrypt: Steganographic Encryption Disguised as Pet Sounds (33 points | 9 comments)
8. My 16-month theanine self-experiment (607 points | 324 comments)
9. Infisical (YC W23) Is Hiring for Full Stack Engineers in San Francisco ( | hide)
10. Nickel superconductor works above -233°C threshold at normal pressure (11 points | discuss)
11. 16-Bit to 1-Bit: Visual KV Cache Quantization for Efficient Multimodal LLMs (45 points | discuss)
12. Goravel: A Go framework inspired by Laravel (108 points | 86 comments)
13. Anti-Schelling points and waiting for my barista-made coffee (6 points | 2 comments)
14. Why Layoffs Don't Work (196 points | 292 comments)
15. Show HN: C++ AWS MSK IAM Auth Implementation – Goodbye Kafka Passwords (27 points | discuss)
16. AI tools are spotting errors in research papers (553 points | 197 comments)
17. Gleam v1.9.0 Released (143 points | 28 comments)
18. Presenterm: Markdown Slideshows in the Terminal (252 points | 38 comments)
19. Online Embedded Rust Simulator (93 points | 14 comments)
20. Building an open-source Wi-Fi Mac layer for the ESP32 (140 points | 21 comments)
21. US Ends Support For Ukrainian F-16s (724 points | 1260 comments)
22. Orange Pi RV2 is a single-board PC with an 8-core RISC-V processor (36 points | 7 comments)
23. Show HN: I built an app to get daily wisdom from Mr. Worldwide (275 points | 72 comments)
24. The DOJ still wants Google to sell off Chrome (422 points | 598 comments)
25. LFortran Compiles Prima (55 points | 13 comments)
26. Stem cell therapy trial reverses "irreversible" damage to cornea (175 points | 31 comments)
27. "Big 3" science fiction magazines including Asimov's and Analog acquired (139 points | 77 comments)
28. H3: For indexing geographies into a hexagonal grid, by Uber (87 points | 35 comments)
29. I've been using Claude Code for a couple of days (137 points | 186 comments)
30. Discovering errors in Donald Knuth's TAOCP (189 points | 55 comments)
